title: ABS Modulator - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Notice - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork.
Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Seat, Battery and Fuel Tank Removal T*1
Drain the fluid from the front and rear master cylinders by draining the system at the calipers until all of the fluid has been expelled.
Front wheel speed sensor electrical connector
Front brake light switch electrical connector
Position the harness to allow access to the roll over valve and front brake light switch electrical connectors, disconnect the connectors.
Route the rear brake switch cable away from the frame to allow it to rotate when removing the rear brake switch.
Disconnect the rear brake switch from the main harness, noting the routing of the cable for installation.

body.name: frame front electrical connectors and carrier_TH1_TP0236

body.body: Front wheel speed sensor electrical connector
Release the fixings and remove the electrical connector carrier.
Disconnect the ABS modulator electrical connector.
Remove the fixings and reposition the harness guide to allow access to the front brake lines.
Release the front brake lines from the twin clip.

body.name: Front brake line clips to frame_TP0244

body.body: Front brake master cylinder brake line
Remove the front brake line brake union bolts, collect and discard the copper washers.
Position the brake lines away from the frame.

body.name: Front brake line to ABS modulator union bolts_TP0248

body.body: Front brake caliper to ABS modulator union bolt
Front brake master cylinder to ABS modulator union bolt
Disconnect the ground connector from the ABS modulator bracket.
Release the rear brake lines from the twin clip.
Remove the ABS modulator bracket fixing from the left hand side of the frame.
Remove the ABS modulator bracket fixing from the right hand side of the frame.
Position the ABS modulator to allow access to the brake lines.
Undo and remove the rear brake caliper brake line from the ABS modulator.
Undo and remove the rear brake switch and brake line from the ABS modulator.
Collect and discard the copper washers from the rear brake switch, brake union bolt and the ABS modulator.

body.name: Rear brake line to ABS modulator union bolt and switch_TP0250

body.body: Rear brake master cylinder to ABS modulator union bolt ( rear brake switch)
Rear brake caliper to ABS modulator union bolt
Carefully manoeuvre the ABS modulator and bracket and remove it rearwards from the frame.
Release the fixings and remove the bracket from the ABS modulator.

Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork.
Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Perform the following operations:
Seat - Removal
Battery - Removal
Fuel Tank - Removal
Drain the fluid from the front and rear master cylinders by draining the system at the calipers until all of the fluid has been expelled.

Immobiliser antenna electrical connector
Front wheel speed sensor electrical connector
Heated grip electrical connector
Roll over valve electrical connector
Front brake light switch electrical connector
Position the harness to allow access to the roll over valve and front brake light switch electrical connectors, disconnect the connectors.
Route the rear brake switch cable away from the frame to allow it to rotate when removing the rear brake switch.
Disconnect the rear brake switch from the main harness, noting the routing of the cable for installation.
